FuncDescriptionShort: TD_SAX transform a time series into sequence of symbols.
FuncDescriptionLong: TD_SAX uses Piecewise Aggregate Approximation (PAA) and transform a timeseries into sequence of symbols.
The symbols can be characters, string, and bitmap.

Description: Time series whose value can be REAL or MULTIVAR_REAL.
Input.LangName: data or object or newdata or ... --> Langauges team can work with UAF team to come up with this field

Description: The primary analytical result set contains the SAX representation of the input time series.
The primary result set is accessed using a SELECT statement
Output.LangName: data or object or newdata or ... --> Langauges team can work with UAF team to come up with this field

Params.Name: WINDOW_TYPE
Description: [Optional] If not specified, the GLOBAL type is the default.
Specifies the window type used in the SAX transformation.

Params.Name: OUTPUT_TYPE
Description: [Optional] If not specified, the STRING type is the default.
The output format of the result can be string, char or bitmap.

Params.Name: MEAN
Description: The global mean values that the function uses to calculate the SAX code for every partition
If not specified, the function calculates the mean values for every partition.
If the mean specifies one value and multiple payloads, then the specified value applies to every payload.
If the mean specifies multiple values, then the specified values apply to the corresponding payloads.

Params.Name: STD_DEV
Description: The global mean values that the function uses to calculate the SAX code for every partition
If not specified, the function calculates the standard deviation values for every partition.
If the standard deviation specifies one value and multiple payloads, then the specified value applies to every payload.
If the standard deviation specifies multiple values, then the specified values apply to the corresponding payloads.

Params.Name: WINDOW_SIZE
Description: The size of sliding window used in the SAX transformation and maximum value is 64000.
The window size is required for SLIDING window type.

Params.Name: OUTPUT_FREQUENCY
Description: The number of data points that the window slides between successive outputs.
This is valid for SLIDING window type.

Params.Name: POINTS_PER_SYMBOL
Description: The number of data points to be converted to one SAX symbol.
This is valid for GLOBAL window type.

Params.Name: SYMBOLS_PER_WINDOW
Description: The number of SAX symbols to be generated for each window.
This is valid for SLIDING window type.

Params.Name: ALPHABET_SIZE
Description: The number of symbols in the SAX alphabet.
The alphabet consists letters a through t.
The alphabet size must be [2,20].

Params.Name: BITMAP_LEVEL
Description: The number of consecutive symbols to be converted to one symbol on a bitmap.
For bitmap level 1, the bitmap contains the symbols 'a', 'b', 'c', and so on.
For bitmap level 2, the bitmap contains the symbols 'aa', 'ab', 'ac', and so on.
The range must be [1,4].

Params.Name: CODE_STATS
Description: Indicator that the function prints the mean and standard deviation.

Params.Name: BREAKPOINTS
Description: The breakpoints to form the SAX code based on input data.

OutputFmt.Name: INDEX_STYLE
Description: Specifies the INDEX_STYLE of the output format.
